78 Lorenzo Thompson

Height 6-7

Weight 295

Class Redshirt Senior

Hometown Syracuse, N.Y.

High School Cicero North

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

Career Honors and Highlights

Phil Steele Third Team All-American (2023)

All-CAA Football First Team (2023)

New England Football Writers Association All-New England Team (2023)

All-CAA Football Third Team (2022)

CAA Football Commissioner's Academic Honor Roll (2018)

2023 (Redshirt Senior)

Elected a team captain by his teammates

Started all 11 games at left tackle for the Rams, finishing his career with 37 consecutive starts

Part of an offensive line that allowed teammate Jaâ€™Den McKenzie to break a nearly 70-year-old record when he rushed for 13 touchdowns

Helped URI finish 10th in the nation in passing offense (284.8 yards per game)

Paved the way for the Rams to record 520 total yards of offense at Georgia State (Aug. 31)

Aided the offense in the seven touchdowns (four pass, three rush) that it scored against Bryant (Sept. 30)

Blocked for the Rams as they rushed for four touchdowns against No. 20 New Hampshire (Oct. 28)

Part of an offense that rushed for a season-best 286 yards against North Carolina A&T (Nov. 11)

2021 (Redshirt Junior)

Earned Third Team All-CAA Football honors

Started all 11 games at left tackle

Blocked for the third-highest scoring offense in the league (30.6 points/game)

Also helped Rhode Island rank fourth in the CAA in both rushing attack (168.8 yards per game) and passing attack (235.3 yards/game)

Ranked fifth in CAA with 21 sacks allowed in 11 games

Part of line that helped Marques DeShields rush for 204 yards and a touchdown against UAlbany (11/19)

Helped Rams rush for 183 yards and a touchdown while allowing no sacks against Maine (11/5)

Part of line unit that helped the Rams rush for 170 yards and two touchdowns at William & Mary (10/29)

Helped pave way for Rams to rush for 178 yards and three touchdowns at Monmouth (10/22)

Part of offensive line unit that blocked for 200 yards rushing against Elon (10/15)

Part of an offensive line that paved the way for 288 rushing yards and three touchdowns on the ground against Brown (10/1)

Started at left tackle and was part of line effort that helped Rams rush for 212 yards and three touchdowns (9/10)

Started at left tackle and was part of a line effort that helped the Rams rush for 151 yards and two touchdowns while also allowing just two sacks at Stony Brook (9/1)

2021 (Redshirt Sophomore)

Started all 11 games at left tackle

Part of an offensive line that helped the Rams average 133.6 yards rushing per game

Helped Rhode Island rush for 177 yards and one touchdown in a win over No. 10/9 Delaware (10/9)

Part of line unit that helped Rhode Island rush for 188 yards and two touchdowns against Stony Brook (10/2)

Served as the anchor bearer and was part of offensive line that paved the way for 141 rushing yards and no sacks allowed at UAlbany (9/11)

Started at left tackle and was part of a line effort that helped the Rams rush for 235 yards while not allowing any sacks against Bryant (9/4)

2020-21 (Redshirt Sophomore)

Started at left tackle and was part of a line that allowed just one sack while also blocking for a running attack that gained 234 yards and five touchdowns at No. 6 Villanova (3/13)

2019 (Redshirt Freshman)

Appeared in 11 games on special teams and offense, making one start

Made his first career start against James Madison (11/23)

2018 (Freshman)

Named to CAA Football Commissioner's Academic Honor Roll

Appeared in two games as a reserve/Preserved a redshirt season

Made his collegiate debut against Albany (9/8)

Before Rhode Island

A two-time Second-Team All-State selection

Earned First-Team All-Section 3 and All-County honors at left tackle for Cicero North in 2017

Helped his team post a 20-2 record over the last two seasons

Led Cicero to the Class AA sectional title and a spot in the state semifinals as a senior

The team rushed for 4,190 yards in 2017
